title: Discrete Chebyshev transform
summary: In applied mathematics, the discrete Chebyshev transform (DCT), named after Pafnuty Chebyshev, is either of two main varieties of DCTs: the discrete Chebyshev transform on the 'roots' grid of the Chebyshev polynomials of the first kind T n ( x ) {\displaystyle T_{n}(x)} and the discrete Chebyshev transform on the 'extrema' grid of the Chebyshev polynomials of the first kind.
